climbs.name: Walk the Plank
climbs.fa: BJ Sbarra, Tracy Wilson, John Smollen, Cheyenne Peterman

content.description: Start up the flake. At the end of the finger crack, move left around the roof, then back right past a couple of mantle moves protected by bolts to a final puzzling, mantle crux. The direct finish is 5.11 if you can't figure out the mantle. This is probably harder for shorter folks.
content.location: Start below an obvious, left-facing corner crack that leads to a roof.

content.description: This is a nice, mellow climb just left of pronounced corner.  The bolts are close, and this is a decent warm-up for the area.  There are a few steeper moves near the top, but with huge jugs.
content.location:
It is a third of the way across the 2nd Band, a couple routes to the left (around a corner) of

Airball

.

content.description:
Start with a tricky mid-5.10 move around the first bolt, then cruise easy ground until you make an interesting move left at the third or fourth bolt (use a long runner here).

You are now at a pretty wild overhang with two fixed draws.  Easily clip the first one from the big rest stance, then pull the first move to clip the second.

Now for the excitement: hand traverse right on poor holds with your feet dangling below.  Put your heel up on the hand rail, then crank up with a powerful move to a huge jug.

Above that is beautiful face climbing on knobs with great feet.
content.location: This is two thirds of the way across Tier 2.

climbs.name: Mantle Mania
climbs.fa: BJ Sbarra, Tracy Wilson, Cheyenne Peterman, John Smollen

content.description: Go up the corner, then traverse on a rail to the first bolt. Balancy moves lead to an exciting mantle crux getting onto the big ledge. An easy but airy arête leads to the chains.
content.location:
This is just right of

Walk the Plank

.

content.description:
Start with some straightforward stemming moves, then gain the wide crack.  There are some huge holds on both dihedral faces, which keeps the climbing easier than it would first appear.

Pass through a small roof, then nice hand-size crack climbing, to one final roof move where you'll want a big #4 cam.
content.protection: Several big cams, up to #4.  You can walk them up on the lower section, but save one for the top.
content.location: This is the wide crack in a right-facing dihedral about a quarter of the way across the 2nd band.

content.description:
Start with relatively easy knob and face climbing past 4 bolts.  The angle then steepens and the knobs get smaller.  It's hard 5.11 straight up, or veer left towards

Happy Crack

, then use the big hand rail to get back to the 5th bolt.

Do a big mantle and you'll be below the crux: a slightly overhanging hand crack.  You can't jam as high as you'd like, but get one good hand in, cam your foot high, and crank up for the slopy jug above.  It is easy climbing from there to the top.
content.location:
This ascends the face just right of the wide crack that is

Happy Crack

.

content.protection: 20 or so mostly fixed draws. Bring up to 5 extra.
content.location:
This climbs the biggest roof on the Second Band and is the full extension to the popular 5.12

The Anvil

right in the middle of the sector.

content.description:
The Blacksmith is an extension to

The Anvil

and a great one at that.

Start by climbing the amazing technical 5.12 arete, but at

The Anvil’s

chains, continue up into the massive roof. Make a few very large move to get established on a good crimp, and execute a huge jump to a large, sloper jug below the anchors. Climb into a nice slot full of jugs, and clip the chains halfway through the roof, taking home an amazing 5.13.
content.protection: Fixed draws and a few extra ones.
content.location:
Start by climbing

The Anvil

(popular 5.12b in the middle of the second band), and continue for 25 feet into the incredible roof to a set of anchors halfway though the feature.

content.description:
Fun route! Start to the left of

Airball

. Follow the obvious bolt line straight up. Crank off small pockets and crimps to a dyno (or long reach), passing a short roof move as you head up the final arete where it eases off with enjoyable face climbing to the chains.

Stem and face climb past several bolts to an awkward overhanging move.  Thrutch through this single tough move by reaching far out right to a good hold and hop onto a large ledge.

From there, take the fun finger/hand crack 40' to the top.  You'll want cams from .3" to 2" for this section.
content.protection: About 5 bolts, cams from 3/4" to 2".  There are anchors at the top.
content.location: Halfway across 2nd Band, look for a bolted face leading to awkward chimney-like move, to a beautiful finger/hand crack to top.
